🚨PLEASE CHECK RECENT AND PINNED POST FOR RELEASE DAY UPDATES 🚨💀🖤COVER REVEAL🖤💀I am so excited to finally reveal the cover of City of Darkness! As we know the release was originally supposed to be today (thank you all for your support with my needing to push it back) but I figured January 30th will still be here before we know it and what better day to show you the cover!
@byhangle did an amazing job on this, as usually she just *got* the vibe and everything I’m going for in this book.🖤
Yes more Hanna and Death (and also Lovia and Tuonen POVs), yes more dark depravity and spookiness of this macabre Underworld and The City of Death, more bizarre creatures, magic, and of course spice 🔥🌶oh and Sarvi 🦄🕸
City of Darkness is book 3 of the Underworld Gods series—a dark fantasy high heat new adult romance based on Finnish mythology—releasing January 30th 2023. Preorder link in bio!🦇

Valtu & Dahlia (and IG framed it so the slightly NSFW part is cropped out😆).
Organ scene from Blood Orange, anyone? 🎼 
I’ll take music lessons from Professor Aminoff any day.
Art by @sage.and.other.herbs who did such a stunning job! 🖤💀😍

🚨PLEASE CHECK RECENT AND PINNED POSTS FOR UPDATES ABOUT RELEASE DATES 🚨Hey I’ve gotten lots of questions about this so I thought I would clear the air 🖤
I will be offering the special edition (with dustjacket) of Black Rose next week in my Etsy store. There will be copies for sale by themselves, plus combined with Blood Orange, plus a book box of them both with a candle. There are lots of copies so don’t worry about them selling out fast! Also they won’t ship until mid January.
👉🏻HOWEVER because I only shipped out the Blood Orange books the other day, the book is already on a reseller site for an inflated prices, this is despite the fact I said “please do not purchase this book if you plan to resell.” NOW I totally understand wanting a signature only option if you haven’t read the book and then did and now you want to sell it or you have to move or need $ in the future and now you have to sell it.
But people have bought it with the intention to resell. If the package was literally delivered into your hands yesterday and today you put it up for resale at triple the price, then that was your intention all along.
This is a predatory practice. It happens all across the book world, I know, but in my opinion, it’s taking away the chance for those who love the book to buy it at the right price. I am not creating these editions and going through the work of selling them so that someone else can make a profit.
👉🏻SO in order to combat this, I have done a 180 and am now doing personalization ONLY. I’m sure some of you will be mad at me but you should get mad at the person who bought it to resell it because this is the tactic I am doing to fight this (it’s either this or charge more) 🤷🏼‍♀️
👉🏻Anyhoo so going forward — and just for Black Rose — I am doing personalization ONLY. So if you want to buy the book, it will be made out to the name of the person who is on the address (or any name you choose, you can tell me. Again, no quotes). Sorry but this has forced my hand to do this.
The reseller(s) will be banned too.

Aren’t these the cutest sketches of my vampires from @andrea.sketches ? 😍Amethyst, Wolf, Valtu, Dahlia Rose, Solon and Lenore 🖤
Amethyst & Wolf are from Nightwolf, Valtu & Dahlia are from Blood Orange/Black Rose, and Solon & Lenore are from Black Sunshine/The Blood is Love💋

MASKED 🖤My dark, gothic and ultra spicy Phantom of the Opera retelling is coming March 23rd (preorder link in bio). This is a complete standalone and part of my upcoming A Gothic Shade of Romance series of retellings of classic gothic and horror novels💀
I am so excited for this series to kick off. Having started my career writing horror romance books, and being a huge lover of classic horror and gothic romance, this project is meant for me and I’m so grateful that gothic romance is finally getting the attention it deserves. Readers who have been with me since the beginning know how well-suited my writing and voice is to all things dark, sexy and spooky🖤
I already have one set of covers designed for the first three books in the series and they are GORGEOUS! I will have two sets of covers, one for either hardcover or special edition hardcover, and the other will be in paperback/ebook.
More info to come next year (going to concentrate on Black Rose and City of Darkness first). But if you love the dark and super sexy vibes of Blood Orange, no doubt you’ll love Masked and the rest of the books 🥀
In the meantime…go read Blood Orange if you want a taste of what’s to come 🖤

I’ll try not to make this too long. The truth is, I am not okay. You know how honest I am and you know I can’t hide it. I’m not okay. I’m struggling. I keep trying to do my best and it feels like I’m constantly failing. I keep breaking down, over and over again. I say to my husband during many nights where I’m beside myself in horror, “I feel like I’m spinning my wheels and no matter how hard I try I can’t get ahead.” Can’t write on time. Can’t find happiness. Can’t just…crawl out of this hole.
Maybe it’s the season. Maybe it’s grief over losing my brother and father last year, because grief does funny things to you, yes even later. Grief doesn’t leave. Maybe it’s my health…physically, mentally.
Whatever the reason, it’s clear I’m not cut out for a lot of things. Definitely shouldn’t run an Etsy store (not the best at customer service). Maybe not even cut out for publishing. Deadlines are something I can no longer work with.
I just know I am at my worst right now.
I apologize to anyone I have let down. I apologize if this means preorders or books get cancelled or moved. I will do all in my power to write the books I have promised you - but it might take longer. Please have patience with me. The stories are there, I just need to work through what’s happening to me now. Find my happiness first. Find my way to the light again.
I just need to go away for a bit and do what’s best for me and for the readers too. I love you guys, I truly do.❤️
(If anything changes about my publishing schedule I will let you know here. Just need a think first).

Thank you for your understanding with my last post. Though I’ve been very honest and open with you before, it doesn’t stop it from being very scary each time I open up. I worry I’m being judged harshly. I worry that people’s trust in me as an author will change. I worry that I won’t be liked or tolerated anymore. I know I’ve pushed my limits with everyone.
With all that said, I am making changes in order to help myself and get better mentally and physically:
1. My Etsy store is closing for good - December 31st will be the last day to place orders. As I’ve said before, I don’t really handle the demands of running a store very well nor dealing with customers. My personality isn’t built for it and I am way too sensitive.
2. All my preorders in 2023 are getting cancelled and my release dates are changing. I have not lost passion for writing, so all books I promised are coming, I just need space to write on my own terms with no deadlines. Black Rose is still my next release. The delay won’t be huge. But I won’t know the date until I’m done the book. Same goes for City of Darkness, etc. I will lose my ability to put up preorders for anything for a year, so it means only live releases will happen. But please know, these books ARE coming and I won’t let you down.
3. If you preordered Black Rose on Amazon and then bought the hardcover on Etsy and sent the screenshot, I will still honor the art print and bookmark to go with it! And also, this means the special edition hardcover will ship out a little later than as promised. Roughly 2 weeks after whatever the release date ends up being. If you wish to cancel your order, that’s ok (do note with the store closing you won’t be able to buy it again in the future).
4. I’m going to step away for a bit. I have a dark fog of horror that I need to crawl out of. I need to find that light again. My husband said I am in an emotionally abusive relationship with myself and he couldn’t be more right. Believe me if you think I’m a bad person, I’m already thinking it about myself.
(CONT IN COMMENTS, please read⬇️)

💔Our unit of 3 is now a unit of 2. Our beloved dog of 10 years, Bruce, very peacefully left us today, surrounded by his loved ones in our place in LA. We rescued him as a scared and skinny stray from California and this is where he also passed, happy and full of love but very ready to go. I have no doubt my father welcomed him on the other side 🌟but the loss my husband and I feel right now is indescribable and devastating and losing Bruce is losing yet another part of myself. Too many voids left by too many loved ones who left us too soon. I don’t know how I’ll go on…but I know I must.
Bruce - also known as Mr. Poo, Boofus, and Boo Boo Pantalony Pants - changed from a fearful timid dog to one full of love and happiness. He was a real goofball at heart and loved the sun and traveling. He was my soul dog and best mate and honestly, the perfect dog for us. We saved him but he also saved us. We are so grateful for the best decade he was with us.🫶🏻
3 things: Bruce was diagnosed with advanced kidney disease in December. By the time you see symptoms it’s too late. Please advocate for your dog to get yearly blood tests to catch it so you can slow the progress.
🐾Also, since we rescued him, I want to help all the dogs I can just as we helped Bruce. For 2023 I will be donating to a diff animal shelter each month. Any donations from you is much appreciated and I’ll announce the donations end of each month 🙏🏻
Also…understandably, now I am deeper in to my social media and writing break. For more info see my pinned post here. Black Rose, City of Darkness are coming but I don’t know when. Past Etsy orders are still shipping. I don’t check my DMs so please email Michelle at info@reckless-readers-society.com if you must get in touch.
I don’t know when I’ll be back. When I’ll be writing. When books are coming. I have so much grief to process. But I wanted to share this news with you because so many of you have loved Bruce just as I have ❤️🙏🏻💫

THE NEWS YOU’VE BEEN WAITING FOR 🚨
First of all I want to thank you for all your love over the loss of Bruce (more about that in my last post or in my most recent newsletter). It’s been nearly two months since he died (and two months since I was last on social media) and it’s been a struggle, to say the very least. Especially when you add it to the very low mental state that I was already in. Bruce had been so vital to helping me deal with my grief that it’s just not fair that he’s gone. He was more than just a dog, he was my heart and soul. Sometimes life doesn’t seem to hold back from handing out shit but we don’t have much choice but to accept it and keep going and try to remain soft instead letting the world make you harder.
So here I am! I am putting one foot in front of the other and I’m still going.
And I’m writing.
Finally.
So much so that I finally have a release date for Black Rose!👏🏻
Are you ready for this dark gothic vampire romance??🖤🥀

Valtu IS Dracula in all his dark & monstrous glory in Black Rose and I’m not the only one who loves it (I’m talking about you all who love the nearly irredeemable asshole with his penchant for sexual punishment using musical instruments 😈) 🖤🥀🎻Have you read Blood Orange and Black Rose yet??

Now that Black Rose has released and completed the Dracula Duet, I know I’ll start getting questions about when City of Darkness is coming.
Unfortunately I can’t give you an exact date. I sent out a newsletter last night explaining in more detail, but because of all the recent events (losing my dog, dealing with loss of father and brother, mental and physical health challenges, plus lots of other stuff that’s happening right now—not all bad) that makes writing difficult, I am not committing to release dates this year until the book is almost done.
I am also not writing anything unless I feel called to it — believe me, forcing myself to write City of Darkness will ruin the book for me & you (there’s a reason why I waited months to finally tackle Black Rose) and I refuse to both disappoint readers with my writing and jeopardize my mental health.
BUT what I can tell you is that I have all intentions of releasing City of Darkness (the 3rd book in the Underworld Gods series) before Book Bonanza, which means it will *probably* be a mid-June release! So fingers crossed 🤞🏻
I know you want it sooner but I need more time before I write it because I am also unsure if I will continue with my original plan of 4 books or if City of Darkness will be the last. 
There’s also a lot of pressure to make this book the best it can be, and right now I just need to write something with zero expectations— so if you see me release a random standalone before City of Darkness, that’s why! I haven’t forgotten about Tuoni and Hanna but sometimes you need a palette cleanser (and Black Rose was a heavy book💔).
🖤🥀
I just wanted to let you all know what’s what (yes I plan to do the God of Death novella too, which will include Tuonen’s short story that was published in the Bookish Box’s Winter Anthology).
Also yes I am still doing my Gothic Shade of Romance series and I am very excited about that! I’m hoping Masked (my dark Phantom retelling) and Hide (my dark Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde) or Hollow (Legend of Sleepy Hollow) will come latter half of the year! So those are all the books planned in 2023.
PS if you ever see readers asking, pls refer them to this post!
Thx @bookish.archaeologist 4 📸

Some color to start the week 🌺Aside from Black Rose’s release, March has been an insanely busy month and it’s not over yet. Lots to catch you up on (that’s what happens when you’ve been off Instagram since December basically) but for now here’s some pics from Loreto MX where we just spent 3 wonderful days. It was just what we needed to rejuvenate and relax and boy did it inspire me! I’m itching to write this next story and I can’t wait to tell you all about it! 🌊
In the meantime I’ve tried to answer a lot of your questions about my releases this year in my previous posts but I’ll be doing an FAQ tomorrow which I will then pin, so hopefully that will be helpful!

I get a lot of questions on various posts so I hope that by pinning this one I can answer all of them in one spot🙏🏻So here are answers to frequently asked questions:
🖤What is your next release?
A Ship of Bones and Teeth - standalone dark fantasy romance that just came out.
🖤Why aren’t you releasing City of Darkness next?
Because I need a palette cleanser after writing Black Rose, a new book with no expectations where I can write whatever I want & not worry about letting readers or a series down. Also I’m dealing with grief issues after losing my brother and father and dog and this affects my writing.
🖤When is City of Darkness coming?
While I can’t give an exact date, I am hoping to publish it late summer 2023. Because of the issues mentioned above, my writing process has changed and I will only write when I want to. I can no longer write because I “have to” and that means more waiting.
🖤The novella God of Death?
That is coming! 
🖤Is City of Darkness the last book in Underworld Gods? 
Not sure yet, hence why I am taking my time with it. Originally I saw this as 4 books but I may end it as a trilogy!
🖤What about your retelling series of gothic/horror classics?
A Gothic Shade of Romance is primed for late 2023. This is a series of spicy darkish romance standalones & will start with Masked (a Phantom of the Opera retelling) & then either Hide (Dr. Jekyll/Mr. Hyde) or Hollow (Legend of Sleepy Hollow) with Portrait (Dorian Gray), Monster (Frankenstein) & Unseen (The Invisible Man) coming in 2024/25
🖤What about X book?
If you don’t see a book mentioned here it means it’s either not on my radar, has been postponed indefinitely or cancelled, or I don’t have any information about it. Either way it’s NOT coming in 2023!
🖤Are you going to have any more special editions or re-open your Etsy?
I will not be reopening my Etsy store but will have some special editions for sale at a third party store this summer.
🖤Will you have preorders for signings this year?
No. I don’t have the bandwidth to do that. I will have a few books at Steamy Lit Con. So please get to my table early or just bring your own🥰

Coming in late May 🌊💀🖤🔮🗡Dark. Gothic. Fantasy. Romance. Standalone. ASOBAT (the acronym for the yet-to-be-announced title) is going to be my palette cleanser in between Black Rose and City of Darkness (pls check my pinned FAQ post for more info about City of Darkness + other releases). It’s going to be a big fat epic standalone that is set in the same world as my other books but absolutely not connected to any other series. And it’s very dark, ultra-spicy and bloody and magical and in some ways unlike anything I’ve written before, and I’m already in love with my hero and heroine.💣
Actually it reminds me of my Sins & Needles books (which aren’t fantasy, but I digress), & you’ll know they’re about a bad girl trying to be good. Well ASOBAT is about a good girl trying to get back to her bad side—and the wickedly sexy villain who pushes her in that direction. 😈
It’s also a re-imagining of a popular fairytale, mashed up with another with a dark romance slant, and I have so many great things planned for this book! And the PR boxes are going to be off the hook! 👏🏻Can’t wait to share the title, tropes, blurb and cover(s) with you eventually.🖤

Might I suggest an X-rated dark gothic Dracula re-telling for your weekend reads? Start this duet with Blood Orange 🩸🍊then Black Rose 🖤🥀both available exclusively on Amazon and in KU, paperback and hardcover💀
PS IF YOU LIVE IN LOS ANGELES PLEASE COME SEE ME AT THE RIPPED BODICE BOOK SIGNING TOMORROW🙏🏻

I have no choice but to tease you until I give you the title, the blurb, the cover, the release date etc. So until then, let’s just think about our dear heroine who is so very tired of being good and proper. A woman with regrets. A woman who wants revenge more than anything else - against her husband, against the sea witch who wronged her, against a world which isn’t her own. And the man, the “villain” who lets the dark monstrous side of her come out to play 🖤🔮🕯🔥🌊 🏴‍☠️ 
(As always please check my pinned FAQ post if you have questions about other releases).

If you’ve read my vampire books you’ll know this place well🖤💀🕯While in SF I had to stop by the William Westerfeld house again, where Solon and Lenore (And Wolf and Amethyst and Ezra) live. Last time I was here it was Halloween, I was dressed up as Amethyst, it was dark and foggy and I actually met the owner (tho I didn’t know it at the time). Though it looks way less spooky in the day time, still has awesome vibes for miles. I hope that the owner gets to open it as a museum one day like he plans to, because there is so much history inside the house, from the Dark Eyes club and ballroom in the basement, to the claw marks left on the walls from an actual tiger (I choose to believe they were left by Solon in beast form though!)🖤

Introducing Princess Maren 🌊💀🕯🧜🏻‍♀️🖤🗡When she was just 16 she sold her soul to a sea witch, exchanging a life underwater for one above, so as long as she could marry Prince Aaron. Fast forward 10 years and she’s married to the cruel abusive prince and would do anything to return to her true monstrous nature and get revenge on both the witch and her husband.
Only one man stands in her way…but he may also bring her salvation.
🌊Yes ASOBAT is a gothic dark romance fantasy retelling of the Little Mermaid, reimagining what her life would have been like had the prince turned out to be a real asshole, and had she been a man-eating (literally) siren. But that’s not the only “story” that ASOBAT is influenced by ☠️
Stay tuned to meet our morally black hero next (though he also loves the term “villain”)🏴‍☠️
ASOBAT’s title, blurb, tropes, release date, and cover(s) will be revealed this month. I’ll also have a special ASOBAT something for free for anyone attending Apollycon 👏🏻
(PS any questions about my other releases this year please check my pinned FAQ post for answers)💋

Daddy Dracula doesn’t mess around 😈💀just read Blood Orange first before Black Rose 🖤🥀This is a completed duet, a gothic vampire dark romance with five-alarm spice🔥TT belongs to Once Upon a Bookshelf. 👌🏻#darkromance #gothicromance #vampirebooks

Meet Captain Ramsay “Bones” Battista 🏴‍☠️🌊💀🗡Yes. He’s the mysterious pirate lord in charge of his notorious crew “The Damned Dozen” on the ship Nightwind. Powerful, wicked and opportunist, Ramsay takes our heroine hostage on a journey across the ocean, while the sexual tension rises until it combusts🔥 (we love a man that’s good with ropes 🪢and chains ⛓ ) and secrets spill out like octopus ink 🐙 🗝
If you’ve seen my previous post about Princess Maren, you’ll know it’s a fantasy romance and a dark gothic Little Mermaid retelling🧜🏻‍♀️. But now you know it’s also mashed up with Pirates of the Caribbean, especially with those spooky horror vibes I love so much, but with characters more morally black than gray 🗡☠️Guess I’m going very “dark Disney” for May🫦💀
👉🏻ASOBAT’s title, cover, blurb and release date will all be revealed over the next few weeks. This book is a complete standalone.👏🏻
(As always answers to any questions about my other releases for 2023 can be found on my pinned FAQ🖤).
ARRRRRRRRRRRRE WE EXCITED?!🏴‍☠️

Sign, sign, everywhere a sign 🎶
Our trip back home let me know I was on the right track with ASOBAT 🌊🏴‍☠️🧜🏻‍♀️Okay so I am loving your reaction to Ramsay and Maren’s reveals (see previous posts) so I think I’ll be announcing the title this week👏🏻

HERE WE GO! TITLE REVEAL 🏴‍☠️ASOBAT = A Ship of Bones & Teeth ☠️🌊I have loved seeing your very creative guesses to the title and I’m happy to finally reveal it, along with some tropes! Of course this title has been up for a month now on my Pinterest page, so I know some of you probably saw that lol (if you haven’t, I have a ton of vibes and aesthetics for the book on there🗡🕯🌊). 
If you need more info about our hero and heroine please see the last few posts about Captain Ramsay “Bones” Battista and Princess Maren 🧜🏻‍♀️This is a standalone gothic dark fantasy romance with high spice🖤
Cover, blurb, release date and PR box sign-ups will be revealed over the next few weeks AND I will have FREE paperbacks that include the first five chapters and a picture-filled guide to this fantasy world with a special cover ☠️🥀available on a first come-first serve basis at Apollycon👏🏻👏🏻👏🏻

🖤🕯Gothic, vampire and dark romance lovers: If you’re thinking of reading BLOOD ORANGE, here’s the content warning. You can find this inside the book using the “look inside” or sample feature on Amazon but not everyone knows to look there (and if I listed these triggers directly on the book’s Amazon page, it would surely cause problems) so I thought I would post them here! I know this book released in October but since the conclusion to the duet, Black Rose, released recently, a lot of new people are discovering my Dracula-retelling and I want to “warn” them 🥀
I will have a content warning posted for A Ship of Bones and Teeth here too but it won’t be as extensive as this one (because there’s only one Valtu and he certainly has his own tastes 😏)

HOIST THE COLORS! 🏴‍☠️Here’s the cover for A Ship of Bones & Teeth in all her glory! I’ve been teasing you with the tropes for weeks now so you all know what to expect, so how about a blurb:
Princess Maren is a woman with a secret. When she was just 16-years old, she sold her soul to the sea witch Edonia, giving up a life underwater in exchange for the love of Prince Aerik on land. But after a decade of abuse and misery inflicted by the cruel prince, Maren wants nothing more than to leave him and her royal role behind and find Edonia to reverse the spell.
An opportunity for escape presents itself when the prince and princess are traveling overseas and are taken hostage by a band of notorious pirates, led by the fearsome Captain Ramsay "Bones" Battista. Maren has heard the sordid stories about the infamous pirate--not only is his ship supposedly haunted and crewed by the damned, but that no prisoners ever survive. Fortunately for Maren, she learns that the captain also has a score to settle with the sea witch. With any luck, Maren may be able to get her old life back, even if it's being held in the captain's wicked hands.
But Ramsay gets more than he bargained for when he learns who--and what--Maren is, and that her appetite for revenge, freedom, and bloodlust rivals his.
Meanwhile Maren finds herself falling for the pirate's dark nature, even as she discovers that Ramsay has a secret more deadly than her own.
🏴‍☠️
When it comes to the high seas, not all monsters lurk beneath the surface.
🧜🏻‍♀️
Releases May 25th, 2023☠️
Preorder up on Amazon (ebook only, she will be a big one)🐙
Paperback and case-laminate (no dustjacket) hardcover to come on release day. Audio likely (prob next year).

WOW! 😍Ok #Apollycon2023 you were AMAZING! So thrilled I got to meet so many of you, including FINALLY my editor and marketing genius from @berkleyromance Cindy and Jessica, thank you so much for lunch!💕And the sweetest Jordan from Tantor Media who have always been so good to me 🥺🥰

If only she could escape the royal human life and return to her monstrous roots (she’s a Syren after all) and her home in the undersea kingdom…
but she gets taken hostage by a sexy pirate instead 🏴‍☠️

Every single second I’m not writing it I’m thinking about it or talking to people about and I’m hyping myself up 🥰Every person that came to my table at Apollycon I was like, I HAVE TO TELL YOU ABOUT THIS BOOK!😂😂😂

“Oh, just take my c*ck so I can f*ck you and be done with it,” I say.
She blanches, a venomous gaze darting back to mine. “Be done with it?”
“Aye. So I can make you see heaven before you go back to hating me.”
“Perhaps I’d rather f*ck you and hate you at the same time.”
“Anyone ever tell you how immoral your mouth is?”
“Never. I suppose I’ve been saving it for you.”
☠️Excerpt from A Ship of Bones & Teeth by Karina Halle☠️

⁣
“You are the moon, I am the tides.”⁣
⁣
A Ship of Bones and Teeth was an enthralling read. It was a book I didn't realize I needed. I mean, who wouldn't want to read a dark retelling of The Little Mermaid mixed with Pirates of the Caribbean? There were so many twists and turns. One thing I certainly didn't expect was the amount of times I cried while reading. Yet, each tear shed just made me want to turn every page faster and faster. I already miss these characters SO much.⁣
⁣
⁣

⁣
Ten years ago she sold her soul to the sea witch Edonia, giving up a life underwater in exchange for the love of Prince Aerik on land. But after a decade of abuse and misery inflicted by the cruel prince, Maren wants nothing more than to leave him and her royal role behind and find Edonia to reverse the spell.⁣
⁣
An opportunity for escape presents itself when the prince and princess are traveling overseas and are taken hostage by a band of notorious pirates, led by the fearsome Captain Ramsay "Bones" Battista. Maren has heard the sordid stories about the infamous pirate--not only is his ship supposedly haunted and crewed by the damned, but that no prisoners ever survive.⁣

Fortunately for Maren, she learns that the captain also has a score to settle with the sea witch. With any luck, Maren may be able to get her old life back, even if it's being held in the captain's wicked hands.⁣

But Ramsay gets more than he bargained for when he learns who--and what--Maren is, and that her appetite for revenge, freedom, and bloodlust rivals his.⁣

Day 1: Barcelona. The airline lost my one checked bag which held all my stuff for the next 2 weeks (I did have the sense to put the important stuff in my carry-on, a couple change of clothes, some makeup and toiletries, etc). Since we were embarking on a cruise (our first cruise ever for me and my husband so obviously it had to be Europe and it had to be Disney!), it was impossible for the airline to forward it to the ports. Luckily on the day we embarked, they found my bag…and sent it back home to Victoria. Sigh.
But I was prepared and started shopping right away, so I got enough clothes from Zara and Mango for the cruise and got my toiletries from Sephora, plus shoes etc.
Unfortunately because I had to replace what they lost, I didn’t have a lot of time to see Barcelona. I had been by myself back in 2005 but that was a quick visit too. Anyway I would have loved to have gone on a walking tour of my favorite book, The Shadow of the Wind, but I’ll just come back again one day for that since Barcelona is such a special city.
And on the plus side, I hadn’t gone shopping at Zara or Mango since my days in Madrid all those years ago (which many of you know inspired Love in English and The Forbidden Man) so it’s fun to have new clothes (and I will certainly send the bill to the airline!)
As I get more internet on this ship I’ll slowly get you all caught up. In the meantime, thanks for all the ASOBAT love!! It’s pirate night tomorrow here and I am SO EXCITED!!🏴‍☠️🏴‍☠️🏴‍☠️

This is one of my first fantasy reads in years… I’ve read some PNR, some gothic romance with supernatural vibes. But nothing quite like this, and I loved every minute of it!

this story was breath of fresh air for me. It was nostalgic but yet so new at the same time. The author marketed this as "Little Mermaid" meets "Pirates of the Caribbean", and that was spot on. The author takes stories and tails many of us grew up with and makes them uniquely their own story.
the characters are so well developed. They each have their own motivations and desires that bring them together and help move along the story.

Bones our hero is the type of hero I love most. The kind that is drawn to the heroine in a way that's unexplainable, the kind that from day one wanted to protect her. I love the push and pull he has throughout this story, until he comes to terms with his feelings. For a man that's so vicious and cruel to many, He's a big softy to those who matter. He's a multi-dimensional character, in the same way that our heroine is as well.

Our Heroine Marren, gosh I simply loved her. I Loved how her being trusted into this world, brought back who she used to be, the human life changed her, but being amongst the pirates and bones, she gets her fight back. She's so strong and resilient. Shes caring and compassionate to those that she loves, she goes through a lot of heart break and loss in this story, but in the end, she finds her way, and that I found so beautiful and meaningful to me.

This is the type of story that moves you, not just because the love is a once in a lifetime kind, but also because, it shines light on all different kinds of Love, loving yourself, family, and friends, but also teaching you to be true to yourself. After this book i am now Karina Halle Obsessed and I need to read all of her books.
Definitely RATED R for REALLY SPICY 🌶🔥#bookstagram

Hi! I have so many new followers lately I thought I would introduce myself 💕
🖤My name is Karina Halle (pronounced Halle as in Halle Berry). This is my actual (maiden) name.
🖤I’m a Canadian born and raised in Vancouver BC, tho I also have Finnish citizenship.
🖤I’ve gone to university in Auckland, NZ and Kamloops, BC and have my bachelor’s degree in journalism. I also went to Vancouver Film School for screenwriting.
🖤Prior to becoming an author I worked as a film background actor, and a music and travel journalist. 
🖤Even though I’m an avid traveler (first solo trip was to Australia and NZ when I was 18 or 19) I much preferred being a music journalist.
🖤Some of my best moments as a music journalist was partying on the Slayer bus, talking smack with Rob Zombie, hanging on the Deftones bus, drinking backstage with Faith No More many times, standing on the side stage with Jerry Cantrell and Danny Devito, and interviewing Chris Cornell (RIP).
🖤Though this is all in the past, music is very apparent in all my books (especially The Devil’s Metal) and so is travel (I have written about 15-20 books set overseas).
🖤I have written over 70 books in total in the following genres: contemp romance, rom com, horror romance, dark fantasy, PNR, dark romance and romantic suspense.
🖤I started as an indie when I published my first horror romance in 2011 and since then I’ve been published by Simon & Schuster, Penguin, Forever Romance and Montlake. My books have been translated into over 20 languages.
🖤After living on a small island called Salt Spring for 11 years, we recently bought a possibly haunted house in Victoria’s James Bay that was built in 1903. My husband and I also live half the year in our condo in Los Angeles. We are happily kidless.
🖤I’m very honest and open to a fault and have always been that way (which can rub people the wrong way). 
🖤I am a huge advocate for mental health. I also have AuDHD (am very neurospicy) and was born with a physically disability called club feet which has more or less been corrected but I still struggle.
🖤I’ve just emerged from the worst chapter of my life (losing my dad, brother and dog) and feel hopeful about life again 💕

Happy Friday! 🌺If you’re curious about my books and want something perfect for summer, I have a few suggestions for you:
🧜🏻‍♀️🏴‍☠️First, if you’re into fantasy, I absolutely will push A Ship of Bones and Teeth onto you. I’ve heard lots of people say this is the perfect intro to fantasy too, so give it a go if you’re on the fence because you don’t read a lot of it. This is a very spicy dark-ish dark fantasy retelling of The Little Mermaid with Pirates of the Caribbean mixed in, and while there are some horror themes, it’s also perfect for summer because of the tropical and ocean themes 🐟
🍋 If you’re wanting a very sexy and lush contemporary romance between an author with writer’s block and the hot Italian single dad sculptor she has to share a villa in Tuscany with, I can’t recommend this enough. I mean, it has summer in the title!
⛵️💕If you’re craving a grumpy sunshine rom com set by the ocean I have two books for you: Lovewrecked (enemies-to-lovers shipwrecked on a tropical island together) and The Royals Next Door (a teacher and romance podcaster finds herself falling for the very grumpy and brooding British bodyguard who has moved in next door to protect her new royal neighbors). Both books have spice and both are pretty sweet and easy reads that will have you laughing and swooning 🌺

I don’t normally plan far ahead with my writing because I am very much a slave to my muse and I’m a mood writer so I can only write what I absolutely feel like in the moment, and with my ADHD that can change the second something stops being shiny and new. It’s annoying and it makes it so I can’t operate like other writers but it is what it is!
HOWEVER…all of these books are books I’ve talked about LAST YEAR and I still have an itch to write them…so let’s talk about it some more!
💀CITY OF DARKNESS. As you all know, this is coming in Sept (no date set, more info on my previous posts about it Inc my pinned post).
🕯HOLLOW. Would be nice to have this before Halloween but we’ll see. This is a spooky scary slutty retelling of The Legend of Sleepy Hollow and my first “why choose” book because Kat, Crane and Bones are a throuple. First book in my Gothic Shade of Romance series of standalones based on classic gothic and horror novels.
⚔️BEYOND THE NORTH. Being that I AM Norwegian (Halle represent!) and in honor of my father Sven, it is a no brainer that I finally write a book based on Norse mythology. I’ve already set several books in Norway (The Wild Heir, Bright Midnight and the upcoming The Royals Upstairs) but I DID promise him I would write one about Vikings one day so here’s that book, papa🗡It’s probably a standalone but we’ll see what happens. It’s dark and sexy and badass and exciting and full of magic and yes, the villain/hero is Loki.👏🏻
•
So those are my planned books for the remainder of the year. They might not all happen as thought, such is the way of the muse (CoD *is* coming in Sept, don’t worry) but this is literally as far ahead as I will let myself plan. Also why I won’t set release dates until the book is finished and why if you ask “what about this book?” I will not have an answer for you!
•

🔮🔥
ANYHOO! Are we excited for the rest of this year?!

It’s me. Hi. I’m the problem, it’s me. 👋🏻I’m using my selfie from Monday when I went to see Tay Tay at So-Fi (we got Exile!) to want to explain some things:
If you saw my stories from yesterday you’ll know I was left a little comment on my IG, someone telling me that they won’t read me anymore because I’m so inconsistent in my release dates and it’s hurting readers.
Ooof. That hurt. 💔
And yes. I am inconsistent. I always have been. Before I was diagnosed with ADHD I just thought I was a procrastinator. I didn’t realize I needed hard deadlines, leaving things to the last minute in order to get things done, that I needed the adrenaline. 
And there’s really no problem with this…I can write a book in 2 weeks. But when LIFE HAPPENS and I get sick or distracted, even for one day, then that throws me off and I have to push back release. Every single hour counts.
I have been this way since I first started writing in 2011. This isn’t new. But it HAS gotten worse since all the deaths happened and my brain got rewritten by grief. Grief is hard. Grief on an autistic ADHD brain is harder.
I have tried to find work arounds, including not announcing a release date until the book was done. Which was what I was doing for all of 2023. But people wanted to know when City of Darkness was coming. On Tik Tok, on IG, on FB. I had to stay vague. I said this year. Summer. Late summer. September. I never gave a full date on purpose.
And now it’s up for preorder for October 23rd. So there’s your date!
And yet I get a comment about not doing things the right way.
Look. I know the way I operate is a turn-off & I lose readers. I know this series could have been something great if that 3rd book came out in Nov 2022 like it was supposed to. But I can’t help how I feel. I can’t rush this book and I can’t force it.
So I understand why you’d be mad for me releasing Black Rose, A Ship of Bones and Teeth, and Hollow (my Sept release) instead of CoD but please know I’m not being difficult on purpose! My brain is difficult. It’s a challenge. I can’t take meds so I just learn to cope. I am trying to do the right things by you but also protect my health at the same time. CONT IN COMMENTS
👇🏻

I figured it would be a good time to create a new FAQ to pin:
🎃When is Legend coming? Do I need to read Hollow before?
🕯️Legend is coming October 30th and you must read Hollow first 
🖤When is City of Darkness (Underworld Gods 3) coming?
💀November 22 2023 and it’s up for preorder on Amazon
🖤Why don’t you ever do preorders for paperbacks?
💀Because you need to have the final files way ahead of time and that rarely happens with me. Paperbacks and hardcover usually come release week
🖤Why are your audiobooks so far after release?
💀I get audiobook deals for my books so the  dates are up to the schedule that the publishers have
🖤Why is your next release - Hollow and Legend - coming before the book everyone has been waiting for, COD?
💀Because I need more time for City of Darkness to percolate in my subconscious. Meanwhile, I need to work and I have an idea I’m excited to write. Just as I did with A Ship of Bones and Teeth, I am writing when inspiration strikes because that produces the most enjoyable work for me (and I hope you!)
🎃Why is Hollow no longer a standalone?
🕯️Because it’s why choose/MMF and writing three people takes longer than two (as I discovered while writing the book!)But I am very happy with it being a duet now as it gives me time to really sink into the plot and the characters👌🏻
🖤Why can’t you write and release like a normal author and stick to a schedule?
💀Because I am not “normal.” I’m neurodivergent. My brain does not operate the same way, never has, and ever since my dad, brother, & dog died my ADHD has gotten worse. Sometimes this means pushing back release dates, sometimes it means writing other books instead if I’m hit by the muse. I know it’s frustrating to you. I get it. But it’s frustrating to me as I have to live with this very challenging brain. Any patience is appreciated! 
🖤What about Demon Dust? More EIT?
💀Demon Dust will come in 2024, don’t worry. I am on the fence of continuing EIT. I’m quite happy leaving Came Back Haunted as the last book atm
❤️What about Royals Upstairs?
🫶🏻That is up to my publisher but should be Fall 24
👉🏻ANY MORE QUESTIONS? Leave them in the comments and I’ll do my best to answer!

👻BLURB👻
Ever since she was a child, Kat Van Tassel knew that her parents had arranged for her to marry her best friend, Brom Bones, when she became of age. That was until Brom mysteriously vanished from the secretive village of Sleepy Hollow when he was just a teenager.
Now, at nineteen, Kat is fulfilling the tradition of attending Sleepy Hollow Institute, a shadowy and prestigious school that is run by her powerful family. There she starts to fall for her new teacher, the enigmatic, smart, and much older Ichabod Crane, whose fascination with dark magic and the occult brings out a new side of Kat—in more ways than one.
Until Brom Bones suddenly appears in her class. Her childhood friend doesn’t remember what happened to him in the four years that he’s been gone, all he knows is that he’s back in Sleepy Hollow for good. The only problem is, he’s not the same man that Kat knew. Cocky and brash as a youth, this Brom is violent and prone to bouts of madness. It doesn’t help that his reappearance coincides with gruesome decapitations that are plaguing the town, with rumors swirling about a vengeful ghost called The Headless Horseman.
Determined to get to the bottom of the murders and Brom’s volatility, Crane takes Brom under his wing to study him, and they begin to grow close, just as they do with Kat. But the more that the threesome submits to their sexual desires on the path to the truth, the more dangerous Sleepy Hollow becomes.  The Headless Horseman might claim them as his next victims…if something even more terrifying doesn’t get to them first.

Here is the gorgeous full cover to Hollow 🖤🎃🍁I wanted to thank you guys for all your love on the Hollow cover reveal. I’m still going through all I was tagged in and am so overblown by the sheer talent out there 👏🏻

I’m also proud of myself for announcing Hollow last Halloween and actually sticking with the plan of publishing it! Take that ADHD!
👉🏻A couple of things to note: I am NOT marketing this book as a dark romance. I noticed a few posts and hashtags said it was but it’s not. Does it have triggers/content warnings and dark themes? Yes. Is it dark academia and a gothic romance? Yes!
But I have learned to not call a book a dark romance if it’s not quite dark enough for the DR crowd. I understand it’s very subjective but I have been dinged in reviews for my books not being dark enough, so I just really really want to make it clear that if you’re a dark romance reader looking for something super shocking and edgy and super taboo this is not that book. I really want to adjust people’s expectations so the book doesn’t suffer for it (and so people aren’t disappointed! I hate disappointing readers🥺)
BUT if you’ve read ASOBAT, Blood Orange or Black Sunshine then you’ll know Hollow is along those vibes. Dark to some but not a dark romance to many others 🖤
👉🏻Second, I have questions about if this will be in audiobook. I explain more about my audiobook process in my pinned FAQ post (so go check that out) but there is no plans for one at this time. 
👉🏻Third, I have questions about special editions. As I am still trying to find the time to create my ASOBAT special edition (you may have seen the cover reveal), I don’t have any plans to do Hollow as one. It is truly a very expensive and time-consuming process. I also have NO plans for a Book Box to do a special edition hardcover.

And thank you again for the love 🙏🏻

Hey everyone I have something important to say about Hollow. I had meant to include MM/same-sex coupling on the tags/tropes/genre for Hollow. Unfortunately I just put “triggers” when I should have said genre!

In my posts about Hollow I have either gotten pushback from those who aren’t interested in the genre or (sadly) from those whose values don’t align with mine. I was selected to receive an ARC for Hollow to review, and I thank Karina Halle (@authorhalle) for the amazing opportunity. 

Before jumping in, I just want to say that I truly devoured this in one sitting without stopping. I was sucked into this world completely. I cannot even express how much love I had for this, and I am marking it as a top read for me this year.

"𝕴'𝖛𝖊 𝖆𝖑𝖗𝖊𝖆𝖉𝖞 𝖇𝖊𝖊𝖓 𝖙𝖔 𝕳𝖊𝖑𝖑. 𝕬𝖓𝖉 𝕳𝖊𝖑𝖑 𝖎𝖘𝖓'𝖙 𝖉𝖔𝖓𝖊 𝖜𝖎𝖙𝖍 𝖒𝖊."

What you find in here is a witchy, spicy, why choose, MMF,  retelling of Sleepy Hollow with all the gothic romance vibes and dark academia. And the atmosphere Karina creates for this is probably one of the most beautiful things I’ve personally read so far. 

It is magic. The image was painted clearly in my mind, from the school-grounds, the woods, the weather, the characters, everything. 

"𝖄𝖔𝖚 𝖍𝖆𝖛𝖊 𝖒𝖊 𝖚𝖓𝖉𝖊𝖗 𝖞𝖔𝖚𝖗 𝖘𝖕𝖊𝖑𝖑, 𝖘𝖜𝖊𝖊𝖙 𝖜𝖎𝖙𝖈𝖍. 𝖂𝖎𝖙𝖍 𝖊𝖛𝖊𝖗𝖞 𝖜𝖆𝖐𝖎𝖓𝖌 𝖒𝖔𝖒𝖊𝖓𝖙, 𝕴'𝖒 𝖆𝖑𝖜𝖆𝖞𝖘 𝖈𝖔𝖒𝖎𝖓𝖌 𝖇𝖆𝖈𝖐 𝖙𝖔 𝖞𝖔𝖚."

I honestly fell in love with Kat, Brom and Crane - individually and together. I could feel the longing, the want, the moments of self-discovery, the moments of confusion, the deviancy, the softness, and just the general attraction and even personalities that each one held. And I’m adding that Crane and Brom are just… so beautifully written to me. 

I truly can’t wait to see what Karina has in store for us with the second part of this duology. My entire being is truly just buzzing to get my hands on Legend and see what’s next. 

I highly recommend this one. I also recommend to read it while a little autumn storm is sounding outside. Have some candles going for the sake of the full experience. 🕯️

For a moment the room is filled with only the sound of Crane’s animalistic grunts, the creak of the desk, the gasps escaping from Brom, the rhythmic slap of skin on skin, and I think maybe I can back out of the room without disturbing them, without disturbing this.
But then Crane pauses, his hands tight on Brom’s hips, and his head tilts to the side, gazing at me from the corner of his eye. A strand of black hair sticks to his sweat-damp forehead.
“You don’t have to leave, Kat,” Crane says, his voice low and guttural, missing all that smoothness that I’m used to. “Not if you don’t want to. But if you choose to stay, I’ll ask you to shut the door.”

Real talk: It’s nearly been a week since Hollow released and I want to thank everyone who took a chance on this book. It means SO much to me to see your posts and reviews and messages.
🫶🏻
I’m not going to lie, it’s been an extremely challenging release. From someone on my arc team uploading the book to a pirate site the day before release, to me losing followers for posting M/M scenes, to the fact that Amazon has cock-blocked me and won’t let me use ads for the book simply because my book is “why choose” (and has queer characters), it’s been disheartening. Especially that last one: I knew that queer or not heteronormative books were punished (hello book bans 😡) but I had no idea that Amazon would actually restrict my sales because of this. Now I can take away any references to why choose/poly/MMF in my blurb but then how on earth will this book find an audience?
But if I can’t run ads, how on earth will this book find an audience?
This is when being an indie author is really hard. I don’t have great marketing resources that a publisher has, I don’t have any power over Amazon. I don’t have a strong Tik Tok presence. I personally struggle with convincing people to read my books (it’s not my strong suit—I’d rather be writing!) and even with my own long-time readers here i’m coming up against resistance because this type of book isn’t what I normally write (that said I have had numerous MM and MMF scenes in my books before🤷🏼‍♀️).
And it’s disheartening because I truly love this book and I adore my characters and I wouldn’t change a thing. Even if I knew Amazon would make it so I couldn’t sell my book properly, I wouldn’t👏🏻 change👏🏻 a 👏🏻damn 👏🏻thing about Crane and Brom and Kat’s messy relationship.
And I HATE that my books are at the mercy of a corporation that thinks this book is not good enough (morally) to be seen.
Which then brings me back to what I said at the start: THANK YOU to those who have read Hollow, bought Hollow, posted about Hollow—I literally can’t do this without you. I love you and need you 🙏🏻Thank you for making Hollow your spicy spooky season read.🍁💀🎃
Okay, so maybe Crane doesn’t feel like sharing after all 🤷🏼‍♀️🖤🕯️💀

First of all, the vibes and aesthetics were perfection. So spooky and creepy and weird and I loved it so much. I could see everything in my mind and I got goosebumps and shivers and everything. Kat was a great character. She’s coming out of her shell and she’s not one of those characters that denies the things that are happening around her. Especially her suspicions towards her mother. That was refreshing. And she’s not afraid to lean on Crane while she’s brave enough to let him lean on her. And also brave enough to help Brom at risk for her own life. I also absolutely loved Crane. He’s pretty much all in with Kat from the beginning and even though he’s her professor, he just takes the risk and is clear about what he wants. Brom, my sweet and sad Brom. I felt so bad for him. He’s really the final piece to the Kat-Crane-Brom puzzle and I can’t wait for book 2 to see what happens to them. This duet has the potential to knock the Blood Orange/Black Rose duet from the top spot for me. The plot had me on my toes the whole time and the spice had my jaw on the floor. Gimme all the group scenes in book 2!!!!

book review

Hollow
Karina Halle @authorhalle 
Genre: Dark Romance

Kat Van Tassel doesn't have to choose between Brom Bones and Ichabod Crane, and there are worse things haunting them than the Headless Horseman.

"Welcome to Sleepy Hollow. May you never leave!"

This book. THIS FREAKING BOOK. God dangg

Yes, its a smutty retelling based loosely on the eerie legend of Sleepy Hollow. But...OH MY ICHABOD! You really can't blame me if I pictured Johnny Depp the entire time I was reading this

The plot really sucks you in, no joke. All the way from the prologue all the way to the very last sentence.I could not put this book down

Halle does an amazing job creating this eerie unsettling gothic atmospheric setting. You will immedietly be transported into the town of Sleepy Hollow and the surrounding forest that homes the private academy thats just beyond the Sleepy Hollow bridge

The character development. Y'all it was Soo good. I was immedietly drawn to the broken and confused Brom while being swept off my feet by the dashing Professor Crane all at the same time. And although Kat the MFC felt a little juvenile and oblivious at times, it did not deter my enjoyment at all because by the time you reach the end when everyone connects and the plot starts to thicken, the way Kats character is portrayed just makes perfect sense

And THE SMUT, oh boyyy THE SMUT. It.was.absolute.perfection. As the relationships start to build the seggsy scenes become more and more passionate and mesmerizing. I couldn't look away

Perfect amount of HOT and PLOT

A fantastic conclusion to Karina’s Sleepy Hollow duet!! After the cliffhanger in Hollow, I was eager to jump into Legend and see where Kat, Ichabod, and Brom ended up. The creepiness of Sleepy Hollow Institute and the devious nature of the Sisters were definitely brought more to light in this book, and it definitely added to the overall gothic vibe of the story. If you were waiting for more spice, YOU GET IT x10!! 🥵 I’ve always said Karina writes fantastic smut, but the MMF scenes in Legend are top tier HOT. What I also love about the scenes is the emotional connection you get to see between all three characters as their relationships grow. Honestly it’s a beautiful love story!! The ending was really fast paced and tense, and I could see this being one of those epic movie endings in my head 😅 I was really satisfied with the outcomes in Sleepy Hollow as a reader and sad to let these characters go!

Princess Maren is a woman with a secret.

When she was just 16 years old, she sold her soul to the sea witch Edonia, giving up a life underwater in exchange for the love of Prince Aerik on land. But after a decade of abuse and misery inflicted by the cruel prince, Maren wants nothing more than to leave him and her royal role behind and find Edonia to reverse the spell.
An opportunity for escape presents itself when the prince and princess are traveling overseas and are taken hostage by a band of notorious pirates, led by the fearsome Captain Ramsay "Bones" Battista. 

Maren has heard the sordid stories about the infamous pirate--not only is his ship supposedly haunted and crewed by the damned, but that no prisoners ever survive. Fortunately for Maren, she learns that the captain also has a score to settle with the sea witch. 

With any luck, Maren may be able to get her old life back, even if it's being held in the captain's wicked hands.

But Ramsay gets more than he bargained for when he learns who--and what--Maren is, and that her appetite for revenge, freedom, and bloodlust rivals his.

Meanwhile, Maren finds herself falling for the pirate's dark nature, even as she discovers that Ramsay has a secret more deadly than her own.

FYI I’ve been on hiatus this month as I attempt to finish City of Darkness. Fingers crossed I make the deadline, it’s starting to feel impossible for many reasons. This is a hard time of year for me in general…birthday coming up and holidays makes me miss my father and brother more. I always fall into a depression this time of year (even if I’m in a sunnier climate, seasonal affective disorder rears it’s ugly head). Pair that with the fact that, on the advice of my agent and fellow authors, I have had to make my IG private due to an ongoing orchestrated harassment campaign against me—things have been tough and made writing very difficult.
(But I still stand behind supporting innocent civilians + children who are suffering in 🇵🇸😘)
So if you’ve been wondering where I have been and have missed my stories, that’s what’s been happening in my life.🙃
BUT I had to come on here and not only showcase this gorgeous special edition and make sure it gets the attention it deserves, but also thank you for all your wonderful and supportive messages that I’ve got over the last few weeks. They really lift me up. I know this is just a blip and a small price to pay, so I can’t complain too much in the grand scheme of the world where my problems are teeny weeny in comparison! 
But I truly love and appreciate you all. The good vibes are appreciated 🫶🏻Hopefully 🤞🏻🤞🏻🤞🏻 I’ll come back here in a week or so with good news 🤗

✨Blurb✨
•He’s the royal bodyguard. She’s the royal nanny. The annoyingly hot attraction that simmers between them—that’s a royal pain•

James Hunter has made a tactical error. His new role as protection officer to Prince Magnus of Norway was supposed to be an exciting change. Instead he’s marooned on a royal estate in the middle of nowhere charged with chasing after demon children and dodging the machinations of meddling staff. And the crowning jewel in this little drama—the children’s nanny is none other than Laila Bruset. The woman whose heart he broke. The woman who still holds his.

When Laila took the job as a nanny for the Norwegian royal children in order to be closer to her ailing grandmother in Oslo, the last thing she expected was to have her life turned upside down—again. But as much as James gets on her nerves, he’s also getting under her skin, and the tension between them sizzles just as devastatingly as before.

As undeniable sparks turn James and Laila’s battle royal into a more serious game of hearts, nanny and bodyguard will have to decide just how much they’re willing to risk for a second chance at love.
And the heroine is the monster in this one? Sign me up. #bookstagram #darkromance #fantasyromance

Happy Yule (tomorrow). ❄️I had a few more posts I wanted to make before year’s end but decided today that I’m stepping away from social media until the new year.
I know that I will continue to get the inevitable “where is City of Darkness” updates that have been haunting me for a year straight now and I will point you toward my pinned post for an explanation. Please watch the video before making a disparaging comment about me and do take note that I have never been anything but transparent about my struggles with writing and my mental health. Please think twice before being rude to me or any author because they aren’t delivering what you believe you are entitled to. We are absolutely trying our best. The pressure is crushing every aspect of joy from my life to be honest.
As such, I am currently writing City of Darkness. It’s hard this time of year to write anything. It’s coming slowly. It’s not easy. I’m not in a good mental state but I will push through and I’m doing what I can. It will be my next release, so please don’t worry. It will happen in January but I won’t announce when until it’s on Amazon.
Yes, I have book 4 up there. The preorder was already up when I was forced to cancel the preorder for book 3. 
In the new year I hope to come bearing good news in other forms with lots of (good) changes.
In the meantime, I hope you find peace and joy in some moments over the holidays. I know it’s a tough time for many of us, so be easy on yourselves. Sometimes its just about getting through something. This year is definitely one I just need to get through.
See you all in 2024 ✨🙏🏻

Second, I will be having the SE of River of Shadows restocked at @thesignedbookshop but won’t be until Jan/Feb.

Third, I started a REAM during the break! 
What is this, you ask? It’s a Patreon-ish site for authors.
Mine officially launches Jan 1st but I wanted to give you a head’s up as one of the tiers is close to being sold-out and I didn’t want to announce it with one not available!

•Anyhoo•

Ream is a subscription service for serialized writing. There are 4 diff tiers from $3 to $25 a month.
- All tiers will have access to my serialized dark fantasy Fae/vampire romance The Knight and his Queen (working title, tho I did design a cover for now, 2nd slide) which will publish at least monthly.
- They will also have access to special editions made exclusively for my Ream subscribers. These books will be voted on and release quarterly.
- There will also be other serialized books of mine-some that have already been published & maybe some other new ones, plus a monthly Q&A, updates etc

Other tiers may include:
- NSFW art reveals
- arcs
- free ebooks and audiobooks
-bi-monthly swag packs and merch boxes
- access to free signed paperbacks
- Scripts
- unpublished proposals
- short stories
- bonus scenes (which you vote on!)
- and more
•
👀 at the l!nk in my 8io to learn more!
•
Yes, this sounds like a lot but I’ve been proactive and hired good people to help me out with this, especially mailings, and the majority of the content I’ve already written and produced. So I’m super excited to see where this takes me in 2024✨

Okay back to the writing cave with Death & Hanna. Hope you have a lovely New Year! 🤗🙏🏻Thank you for all the year end love!🥹🫶🏻

Made it down to our place in LA just in time to miss the Arctic Outflow back home in BC. Currently writing City of Darkness—not sure when this will release. Actually having a bit of a conundrum. Not with the book itself (yay!) but with release dates.
I mean, the book will be ready when it’s ready and that’s that BUT I was hoping it would be by end of month but with SJM CC3 coming then and people (rightfully!) excited about that book, it’s tricky to know when to release. I am aiming to get the book done so I can release it just a few days before CC3 so at least I can get out the word on social media that the book is finally available.
But if I don’t hit that deadline, then I will probably publish end of Feb so that there’s time for the online hoopla to die down (and Goddess of Light would come end of March?). The best thing about self-pubbing is that you can control your release dates so that your books have a fair chance. I don’t expect much from this book but I also don’t want it lost in the shuffle (aka I don’t want my posts that say “hey the book is out!”to be buried)
Now I’m aware that it’s apples and oranges here BUT I just wanted to keep you updated with my thoughts. I know you’ve all been waiting so long (if you want more background pls check my pinned post) so I truly will try to get this book out this month but if it doesn’t happen, then you know why it would then be end of Feb.
What else? Oh I have so many good things coming your way. New covers, special editions for book signings, special editions for those who subscribe to my Ream. So many good things!
And then…
…the best news of all.
*flails*
Which I hope can share soon because I’ve been sitting on this news for months now but suddenly more good news has (potentially 🤞🏻) been added to the pot.😱💥
All this to say, I’m really emotional and touched and happy and excited and a little scared and I can’t wait for what the future brings! Cross all your fingers 🥹
Okay, I hope you’re all having a great week so far. 🫶🏻
